Ben Barres - Wizard of Glia

Lifetime: SEP 13 1954 - DEC 27 2017
Career: Research Scientist at Stanford University
Fields: Neurobiology, mainly on glia cells

  • Profile
  • Education
  • Research
  1. High School
  2. Bachelor
  3. Medical
  4. Doctorate
  • Prev
  • Next

  1. Science Programme at Columbia College

    n.d.

    During his high school life, Barres had difficulty assessing
    science and engineering knowledge due to his original sex as
    a female. Fortunately, he discovered a science programme at
    Columbia University that has no gender restrictions.

  2. Massachusetts Institute of Technology

    1976

    The knowledge learnt from the course at Columbia University earned
    him a place at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in Cambridge
    for a bachelor's degree in biology.

  3. Dartmouth College

    1979

    Barres finished a medical degree at Dartmouth College in 1979 and started
    a neurology residency at Weill Cornell Medicine. It was at this time he
    found interest in the largely neglected glial cells of the nervous system.

  4. Harvard University

    1990

    Barres later left medicine to pursue a doctorate degree in neurobiology at
    Harvard on the function and distribution of cation channels in glial cells.
    He later had postdoc training at University College London and discovered
    that developing neurons provide signals to the myelinating glial cells — the
    oligodendrocytes — to insulate neuronal axons.
